desc.#text: <p>Version incremented from 0.8 (Provenance) to 1.1 (Provenance) in January 2023 following internal review and updates, and to match the versioning on the PRSB website.</p>
<div>This is a record of an event performed by someone or something. An event can happen at one time and be recorded at another time.</div>
<div>The person, professional or device recording the information in the record.</div>
<div>The person recording the information in the record.</div>
The name of the person completing the record.

<p>The relationship the personal contact has to the person, e.g. father, grandmother, family friend etc. Includes additional roles the person performs on behalf of the other (e.g. carer, next of kin, emergency contact, dependent, etc.).</p>

context.#text: <p>PRSB strongly recommend using FHIR standards when implementing our standards as the agreed transport mechanism.</p><p>FHIR valueset 'UKCorePersonRelationshipType' : -  https://simplifier.net/hl7fhirukcorer4/ukcore-personrelationshiptype-110</p>

desc.#text: <p>The coded value for relationship.</p>

operationalization.#text: <p>Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).</p>

context.#text: <div>Relationships may be customised by users. Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the list of relationships.</div>

desc.#text: <p>Free text field to be used if no code is available. </p>
<div>The professional recording the information in the record. </div>
The name of the professional.<br clear="none"/>
<p>The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker etc.</p>

context.#text: <p>Alignment to the workforce dataset NHS Occupation codes primarily is advised. Where no code is available, free text may be used. Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the roles:</p><p>National Workforce Data Set (NWD) NHS Occupation codes : - <a href="https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/data-collections-and-data-sets/data-sets/national-workforce-data-set-nwd-and-nhs-occupation-codes" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/data-collections-and-data-sets/data-sets/national-workforce-data-set-nwd-and-nhs-occupation-codes</a> </p><p>Other nationally maintained lists include:</p><p>FHIR valueset 'UKCorePractitionerRoleCode' : - <a href="https://simplifier.net/HL7FHIRUKCoreR4/UKCore-PractitionerRoleCode" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://simplifier.net/HL7FHIRUKCoreR4/UKCore-PractitionerRoleCode</a></p><p>SNOMED CT concepts from FHIR R4 : -  &lt;&lt; 223366009 | Healthcare professional (occupation) |  Descendant or self of concept. SNOMED codes are searchable through the browser tool <a href="https://termbrowser.nhs.uk/?" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">here</a>.</p>

desc.#text: <p>The coded value for role.</p>

operationalization.#text: <p>Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s). E.g. HL7 FHIR Practitioner/Role; SNOMED; National workforce dataset; NHS Occupation codes. See implementation guidance.</p>

desc.#text: <p>Free text field to be used if no code is available.</p>
The grade of the professional.
<p>The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health, etc.</p>

context.#text: <p>The ‘Main Specialty Codes’ in Table 1 of the NHS Data Dictionary code list for specialties is advised.</p><p>NHS data dictionary 'Main Specialty and Treatment Function Codes Table': <a href="https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/supporting_information/main_specialty_and_treatment_function_codes_table.html" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/supporting_information/main_specialty_and_treatment_function_codes_table.html</a></p>

desc.#text: <p>The coded value for specialty.</p>

operationalization.#text: <p>Nationally or internationally mandated code system(s) (see implementation guidance).</p>

desc.#text: <p>Free text field to be used if no code is available.</p>

context.#text: <p>PRSB suggest users use generic professional identifier types to suit the customer base where applicable, which should align with nationally identified professional identifier types that are coded (or will be in future).</p><p>Professional identifier types may be customised by users. Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the list of professional identifier types. </p><p>NHS Data Dictionary 'Professional Registration Body Code' : <a href="https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/attributes/professional_registration_body_code.html" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/attributes/professional_registration_body_code.html</a></p>

desc.#text: <p>The type of professional identifier. For example, General Medical Council (GMC); Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC) numbers.</p>

operationalization.#text: <p>Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).</p>

context.#text: <div>This field is to record the actual professional identifier (NHS; NMC, HCPC etc).</div>

desc.#text: <p>Professional identifier for the professional completing the record e.g. General Medical Council (GMC), Nursing Medical Council (NMC) number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.</p>

rationale.#text: Practitioner.identifier (for professional national identifiers),PractitionerRole.identifier (for local role identifiers)

desc.#text: The name of the organisation the professional works for.

context.#text: <p>Use of NHS data dictionary Organisation Data Service (ODS) codes is advised:</p><p><a href="https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/supporting_information/organisation_data_service.html#:~:text=Description-,The%20Organisation%20Data%20Service%20(ODS)%20is%20provided%20by%20NHS%20Digital,Social%20Care%20Organisation%20Reference%20Data" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/supporting_information/organisation_data_service.html#:~:text=Description-,The%20Organisation%20Data%20Service%20(ODS)%20is%20provided%20by%20NHS%20Digital,Social%20Care%20Organisation%20Reference%20Data</a></p><p>Guidance around how to locate ODS codes can be found at: <a href="https://www.digitalsocialcare.co.uk/latest-guidance/how-to-find-your-ods-code/#:~:text=An%20ODS%20code%20(also%20called,Data%20Security%20and%20Protection%20Toolkit." rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://www.digitalsocialcare.co.uk/latest-guidance/how-to-find-your-ods-code/#:~:text=An%20ODS%20code%20(also%20called,Data%20Security%20and%20Protection%20Toolkit.</a></p><p>Users should use the NHS Digital ODS portal to locate specific ODS codes. See: <a href="https://odsportal.digital.nhs.uk/Organisation/Search" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://odsportal.digital.nhs.uk/Organisation/Search</a></p>

desc.#text: <div>The coded value for organisation. </div>

operationalization.#text: <p>Nationally or internationally maintained code list(s) (see implementation guidance).</p>

context.#text: <div>The free text field should be used for any organisations not present in the coded list. For example, many social care organisations may not be coded.</div>

desc.#text: Free text field to be used if no code is available
<div>The device <span style="color: #333333; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, Geneva, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">recording the information in the record.</span></div>
The device type.
The coded value for device type.

operationalization.#text: <p>Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).</p>

operationalization.#text: <div>Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).</div>

Where no alignment is available to standardised lists, users may add to the roles:</p><p>National Workforce Data Set (NWD) NHS Occupation codes : - <a href="https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/data-collections-and-data-sets/data-sets/national-workforce-data-set-nwd-and-nhs-occupation-codes" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/data-collections-and-data-sets/data-sets/national-workforce-data-set-nwd-and-nhs-occupation-codes</a> </p><p>Other nationally maintained lists include:</p><p>FHIR valueset 'UKCorePractitionerRoleCode' : - <a href="https://simplifier.net/HL7FHIRUKCoreR4/UKCore-PractitionerRoleCode" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow">https://simplifier.net/HL7FHIRUKCoreR4/UKCore-PractitionerRoleCode</a></p><p>SNOMED CT concepts from FHIR R4 : -  &lt;&lt; 223366009 | Healthcare professional (occupation) |  Descendant or self of concept.
